010package imagingbook.common.noise.hashing;
011
012/**
013 * Hash function described in G. Ward, "A recursive implementation 
014 * of the Perlin noise function", Graphics Gems II, 1991
015 */
016public class Hash32Ward extends Hash32 {
017        
018        public Hash32Ward() {
019                super();
020        }
021        
022        public Hash32Ward(int seed) {
023                super(seed);
024        }
025        
026        @Override
027        int hashInt(int key) {
028                return hashIntWard(key);
029        }
030        
031        //  lower 16 bits are highly repetitive and perfectly uniform!!!!
032        int hashIntWard(int key) {
033                key = (key << 13) ^ key; // ^ denotes bitwise XOR operation
034                key = (key * (key * key * 15731 + 789221) + 1376312589);
035                return key;
036        }
037}
